newsitem.title: MEXICO: Mexico Cetes rate sharply up on late spike.
newsitem.headline: Mexico Cetes rate sharply up on late spike.

text.p: Mexican overnight Cetes rates closed up 120 basis points at 18.50 percent on Friday after a player offloaded a heavy paper position onto the market in late trading, dealers said.
"It certainly looks like someone was short liquidity," a fixed-income analyst said.

Dealers said rates tended to increase throughout the session as liquidity was squeezed by demand for cash prior to the weekend, and by a very small amount returning to the market from prior central bank operations.
